text:
Hallo,

per Zufall über Yelp auf das Restaurant aufmerksam geworden. Waren dort und mit der Familie gegessen. Sehr schönes und entspannte Atmosphäre. Das Essen war sehr lecker. Wir hatten zwei Pizzen und die 85 (Nudeln mit Pesto und Thunfisch). Als Beilage gab es noch ein leckeren Putensalat. Alles in allem einem eine top Empfehlung. Der einzige Nachteil ist, die lange Wartezeit aufs essen weil der Laden voll war ;-). Man hat auf Anhieb festgestellt, dass der Laden gut sein muss (Anzahl der Gäste). Wenn wir wieder nach Lich kommen sollte, wird es unsere erneute Anlaufstelle sein. Das Personal super Nett und sehr zuvorkommend. 

Vielen Dank auf diesem Wege. Macht weiter so!

Die beste Pizza die ich je gegessen habe !!
Wunder schönes Ambiente 
Wochenende besser reservieren 
Sehr zuvorkommende und freundliche Bedienung

This is a newer restaurant in the area, took over previous restaurant, which I was happy to see go. I was hoping this new restaurant would be a great replacement. Unfortunately, it is not. The restaurant is nicely renovated, very modern, has a separately bar area. We ordered two pasta dishes. Couldn't decide between the butter chicken, pizza or some roast. In my opinion, when you try to incorporate many cuisines into one restaurant, nothing really stands out. Better to be good at one cuisine than mediocre in many. Our orders were taken promptly, and water was brought to our table quickly. It took quite a while to get our pasta. It wasn't busy, there were some tables. When we got our pastas, no cheese or pepper was offered. We asked for bread to be served with our pasta, but no bread was offered either. The presentation looked good, but that's about it. My carbonara was as bland as could be, I had to douse the table salt and pepper constantly. It lacked any kind of flavor. Disappointment. My husband's pasta was also bland and the sauce was on the watery side. He was expecting a hearty tomato cream sauce. The waiter was no where to be found, until we nearly finished our meal. At $15 a plate, with no bread included, the portion size is not worth it. 

Go there for a drink, skip the food.

Went here with my wife after shopping @ fairview mall on Sunday night.  Drove by this restaurant and  immediately noticed that this 'Calabria' replaced the Joe Maggiano's.  Store front looks appealing from outside and it says "restaurant and lounge".
-Waited for 10 minutes for a hostess to seat us even though restaurant wasn't busy whatsoever
-A server saw us and seated us right away after realizing that we waited for so long to be seated
-Decorations is no big deal; cheap table and chair. 
-We got a tomato soup and chicken creamy asparagus soup for appetizers.  To be honest, they both tasted like they used CAMPBELL can soup.  It was both watery and salty.  No breads or cracker were provided.
-We got stone baked asiago pizza and chicken & seafood on rice.  I am not even joking, the pizza tasted like as if it was stomped on the kitchen floor, it was soggy and not at all crunchy.  Toppings on the pizza are cheap and not remotely fresh.   
The chicken & seafood entree was extremely bad too.  Rice was extremely dry, the shrimp wasn't fresh and the chicken tasted like rubber.

We didn't want to complain to the server because she actually provided good service; checking up on us every 10 - 15 minutes.  We figured its not her fault, the problem is the BAD CHEF! They shouldn't be allowed to cook @ all; I eat out a lot and this restaurant is THE WORST I've ever eaten.  Definitely not recommend it to anyone.  Let's put it this way, if i can get a coupon for free appetizer or entree or dessert at this place; I would tear up the coupon.  Waiting time for food is actually pretty long; coz the restaurant was definitely understaffed. 

We didn't bother ordering dessert, since we consider it to be it too risky.

This is the first review i'm writing on yelp, the quality of this restaurant's food leaves me no choice but to warn other people to stay away from this place.

The service was quick at this place, everything else was downfill from there. My friend ordered a Caesar Salad and I ordered a Greek Salad with Chicken. Literally nothing special and it was all very bland in taste. I thought I`d check out a new restaurant in the area, but made a mistake. Although not my concern, but it looked a bit awkward with a guy serving in his jeans.

Waren hier einmal zu zweit auf Empfehlung hier und mehr als begeistert. Dabei hatten wir überbackene Aubergine mit Schinken in würziger Tomatensauce und gefüllte Schweinerolladen mit Kroketten und Salat. Die Portionen waren mehr als reichlich, dass sogar noch was übrig blieb. Dazu gab es noch schön gekühlte Getränke. 

Am darauf folgenden Tag gingen wir noch mit zwei Begleitern dort hier. Diesmal hatten wir Gnocchi mit Gorgonzola, Salat mit Rindertranchen, Zwiebel und gebackenen Schafskäse, Salat mit Putenbrust, Orange und anderen Gemüse und Penne mit Dörrfleisch. 

Es hat alles sehr gut geschmeckt und auch diesmal war es für diese großen Portionen günstig. Die Getränke waren gut gekühlt und zu echt guten Preisen. 

Das Ambiente und der Service war in Ordnung. Das Restaurant ist in rot Töne gehalten, mit dunklen Mobiliar und recht schick. Außerdem gibt es draußen noch einen großen Biergarten unmittelbar an der Hauptstraße. Der Service war zwar etwas langsam, aber freundlich. 

Fazit: ein sehr guter Italiener und wirklich einen Besuch wert, werden auf jeden Fall hier wieder was essen gehen.

The place is a bit overpriced for the quality of food that they provide.. 

Ordered: Appetizers; Tiger Shrimps: don't even order this please.. Scallops wrapped on Bacon, this was excellent.
Entree; a rack of ribs, taste was good.. Nothing special, just BBQ sauce, fries and garlic.. Like home
Dessert; overall was good, and this was better than the entrees lol
